Holds the title of GIF Queen appointed by @yoursunandstars. Master/Mobile List is updated regularly. Requests are closed. Tags are open.

title: Not Exactly Street Fighter
body:
Requested by Nonny ❤ For the 500 Garden Party Extravaganza! 

Audio - by @dystopian-dez382  via @mischievousreadings  

Prompts will be in bold throughout fic:
(Gen) Loki and Peter - friends, Loki has a soft spot for Peter and looks out for him
38: “Are you even listening to me?”  /  “Yes, it just takes me a while to process so much stupid all at once.” 

Pairing: Loki and Peter, platonic ❤

Word Count: 1025

Read on AO3 HERE.

Warnings: None

A/N: Spoiler, but I might have added a bit of Venom to this humorous mix.  ❤

“You must learn to control your strength.” 

“I know, I’m trying.” Peter says pulling off his mask and running a hand down his face.

“You must try harder. It can be your greatest weakness if used against you.” Peter sighs, but lets him continue. “Enough creatures and people want you dead, simply because you are good, simply because you run around with that idiotic band of heroes. You need to perfect this for when it really matters.” 

“You hang around with those idiots too.”

“Yes, but others want me dead for other reasons.” 

“Like what?”

“No, we are not discussing that. We’re trying to focus on you. On keeping you alive.”

“Can you make it fun? This isn’t exactly Street Fighter…. Can you at least make it more challenging for me?”

“Challenging?” Loki’s eyebrow rose in question. “What more do you want me to throw at you? I don’t care to find out how Stark will react if I squash you like the bug you dress up as.”

Peter rolled his eyes so intensely that Loki wondered for a moment if perhaps they’re not related somehow.

“Okay. So, maybe stop sending hallucinations and magic my way. Maybe something bigger like huge rocks or cars?” Peter suggests with wild hand motions as he continues to describe various ridiculous scenarios, each crazier than the last.

Loki’s mood swiftly changes from concern to irritation.

“Are you even listening?” Peter asks, waving a hand in front of Loki’s face.

“Yes, it just takes me a while to process so much stupid all at once.” Loki sighs, trying to formulate a plan that will appease Peter and teach him what he needs to know. “Cars?”

“Cars.” Peter nods, hope alight in his eyes.

“Alright. We’ll start out slowly. I want you to try something different each time. And if you even look like you might be hurt. We’re done with the cars. Are we clear?”

“Yes, sir.” Peter laughs. “You know Steve trapped me under a huge metal container once, right?”

“I beg your pardon?”

“Yeah. It was awesome.”

Loki looks on in disbelief as Peter pulls his mask on and swings off the roof top, down to a large derelict parking lot below.

“There’s some junker cars that have been here for years that we can use!” Peter calls up to Loki.

Loki appears behind Peter in a green mist making him jump.

“And you want to dodge cars.” Loki laughs at his surprise.

“If you can dodge a car you can dodge a ball.” Peter mumbles and takes a crouched stance. “Okay, Mr. Loki, whenever you’re ready.”

Loki sighs, squaring his shoulders before flinging out an arm towards Peter. This time, instead of illusions of large creatures coming at him, a rusty pick up goes flying towards him. Peter easily dodges it, slinging out a web to catch the truck and flings it back at Loki.

Loki chuckles as green swirls of magic radiate from his hands splitting the truck in two and sending both pieces back towards Peter.

Peter shrieks in glee dodging one half of the truck and flinging the other to the ground, landing in front of it and motioning with both hands for another car.

Loki sends a large van his way and Peter flings it back to him.

“No, no. Something different. If you constantly use the same techniques, you become predictable and can be easily defeated. Remember I’m trying to kill you, not stop you.” Loki says, picking up a small compact car. “Again.”

Peter tries a different maneuver, falling half way through, and rolling to land awkwardly on his feet but still managing to avoid the car.

“Maybe if I try it like this?” He asks himself out loud, motioning for Loki to throw another car his way.

He goes again. This time bouncing off a wall.

“Am I doing good?”

“Mostly. Do you need another challenge?”

“Yeah. Stop going easy on me.” Peter shouts over the crash of the latest car being thrown into the ground.

“If you think you’re ready for it.” Loki smirks, enjoying the boy’s energy, skill, and intuition.

He flings one car from in front of Peter, then one from the side. Peter uses his webs to deflect the first and pull himself out of the way of the second. As quick as Peter is, he’s no match for Loki’s magic, as car after car come near him. Some thrown at him, some to distract him.

He dodges one, then another. A roll here. A web there. Then nothing.

Peter hears birds chirping and feels a slight breeze on his face. Blinking his eyes open, he looks around and realizes that he’s flat on his back with Loki lying next to him aimlessly picking at his nails to his side. 

“Why are we laying down in a parking lot?”

“We were training.”

“Okay that I remember.”

“And you hit the wall over there and went unconscious.”

“Yeah, that’s where things get blurry…”

“So, I lied down next to you so everyone would think we’re just ‘chilling’ as you say.”

“Really? That’s nice of you.”

“You’ve been out for a while: I got bored and tired.”

“You’re not mad?”

“Not anymore.” Loki sighs, looking over to Peter. “But we’re done for the day. And you’re going to the healers once we get back.”

“Thanks Mr. Loki. You’re pretty cool.”

“You are welcome, young Peter.”

“You’re the best babysitter Mr. Stark’s set up for me!”

“Since when is babysitting you my… By the Norns, that is exactly my job.”

From across the street, Venom sits atop a window ledge perched precariously, his head tilted to the side in curious speculation. 

“What a bunch of losers.”

“Is that really Loki? With that Spider Boy?”

“We believe so.” Venom pauses with a sigh. “If anything where to happen to either of them, we will eat everyone in sight.”

“You can’t just –“

“We will eat everyone!”

Eddie sighs, “But Loki –“

“Everyone!”

Eddie concedes after a long pause. “Yeah. Okay.”

Venom watches as Loki helps Peter stand.

“Snacks. Snacks as far as we can see!” He murmurs, jumping off the window ledge.

“And you want to dodge cars.” Loki laughs at his surprise.

“If you can dodge a car you can dodge a ball.” Peter mumbles and takes a crouched stance. “Okay, Mr. Loki, whenever you’re ready.”

Loki sighs, squaring his shoulders before flinging out an arm towards Peter. This time, instead of illusions of large creatures coming at him, a rusty pick up goes flying towards him. Peter easily dodges it, slinging out a web to catch the truck and flings it back at Loki.

Loki chuckles as green swirls of magic radiate from his hands splitting the truck in two and sending both pieces back towards Peter.

Peter shrieks in glee dodging one half of the truck and flinging the other to the ground, landing in front of it and motioning with both hands for another car.

Loki sends a large van his way and Peter flings it back to him.

“No, no. Something different. If you constantly use the same techniques, you become predictable and can be easily defeated. Remember I’m trying to kill you, not stop you.” Loki says, picking up a small compact car. “Again.”

Peter tries a different maneuver, falling half way through, and rolling to land awkwardly on his feet but still managing to avoid the car.

“Maybe if I try it like this?” He asks himself out loud, motioning for Loki to throw another car his way.

He goes again. This time bouncing off a wall.

“Am I doing good?”

“Mostly. Do you need another challenge?”

“Yeah. Stop going easy on me.” Peter shouts over the crash of the latest car being thrown into the ground.

“If you think you’re ready for it.” Loki smirks, enjoying the boy’s energy, skill, and intuition.

He flings one car from in front of Peter, then one from the side. Peter uses his webs to deflect the first and pull himself out of the way of the second. As quick as Peter is, he’s no match for Loki’s magic, as car after car come near him. Some thrown at him, some to distract him.

He dodges one, then another. A roll here. A web there. Then nothing.

Peter hears birds chirping and feels a slight breeze on his face. Blinking his eyes open, he looks around and realizes that he’s flat on his back with Loki lying next to him aimlessly picking at his nails to his side. 

“Why are we laying down in a parking lot?”

“We were training.”

“Okay that I remember.”

“And you hit the wall over there and went unconscious.”

“Yeah, that’s where things get blurry…”

“So, I lied down next to you so everyone would think we’re just ‘chilling’ as you say.”

“Really? That’s nice of you.”

“You’ve been out for a while: I got bored and tired.”

“You’re not mad?”

“Not anymore.” Loki sighs, looking over to Peter. “But we’re done for the day. And you’re going to the healers once we get back.”

“Thanks Mr. Loki. You’re pretty cool.”

“You are welcome, young Peter.”

“You’re the best babysitter Mr. Stark’s set up for me!”

“Since when is babysitting you my… By the Norns, that is exactly my job.”

From across the street, Venom sits atop a window ledge perched precariously, his head tilted to the side in curious speculation. 

“What a bunch of losers.”

“Is that really Loki? With that Spider Boy?”

“We believe so.” Venom pauses with a sigh. “If anything where to happen to either of them, we will eat everyone in sight.”

“You can’t just –“

“We will eat everyone!”

Eddie sighs, “But Loki –“

“Everyone!”

Eddie concedes after a long pause. “Yeah. Okay.”

Venom watches as Loki helps Peter stand.

“Snacks. Snacks as far as we can see!” He murmurs, jumping off the window ledge.

“You must learn to control your strength.” 

“I know, I’m trying.” Peter says pulling off his mask and running a hand down his face.

“You must try harder. It can be your greatest weakness if used against you.” Peter sighs, but lets him continue. “Enough creatures and people want you dead, simply because you are good, simply because you run around with that idiotic band of heroes. You need to perfect this for when it really matters.” 

“You hang around with those idiots too.”

title: Prototype (Part 6) | Reader x Peter Parker
body:
Wordcount: 2,011

Genre: Male!Android!Reader x Peter Parker/Spider-Man | Marvel (MCU) x Detroit: Become Human AU

Summary: “Not long after Tony Stark attends CyberLife’s Annual Investor & Shareholder Conference, the New Avenger’s Facility becomes freshly staffed by various CyberLife Androids. One particular model - the new ST400 - becomes a personal project of Mr. Stark’s. He could never have known that interactions with a particular young Avenger would impact his project in ways he could never have imagined.”

Warnings: Language, Mentions of drug use, Fighting

Author’s Notes: I’m baaaack~! Sorry to have this hang for such a long time. I’ve just been really busy with work stuff as well as stuff in my personal life. I’m glad to be back and to continue my writing :) I hope this chapter was worth the wait - the story will take interesting turns from here so buckle up! ;)  Also, if you want to be on the tag list for this fic just let me know in a comment

With the package in hand, Peter made his way down the long hallway with (Y/N) to Hangar 08. As they navigated through the maze the was the New Avengers Facility, Peter glanced around, seeing the various Androids at work. After weeks of doing his routes, he could recognize and name just about all of them. There was Ruby, a custodian Android, peacefully mopping the floor. And then there was Justin and Lauretta, a couple of lab technician Androids, strolling down the hall in the opposite direction. All three of them took time to say hello to Peter - completely ignoring his suit.

Again the idea of deviancy fluttered into Peter’s head. It was like a headache that just wouldn’t pass. While he waved back to the Androids, his mask was hiding a quiet frown. What was it about deviancy that was so bad? He knew that some deviants had hurt people before, but people also hurt people. And what causes the phenomenon? Could Ruby end up becoming a deviant? Could Justin or Lauretta? What about Rebekah? What about…(Y/N)? That last thought lingered in Peter’s head like an echo in a cave, trailing back deep into his mind where it couldn’t be forgotten.

“Peter?” (Y/N) spoke up, snapping Peter out of his thoughts.

“Y-Yeah?”

“You seem a little quiet. Is there anything you’d like to talk about?” (Y/N) sounded concerned - but again this upset Peter. Could (Y/N) even be concerned. These thoughts just made Peter more and more confused - and frankly a little sad. He did his best to ignore them.

“I-I’m just a little nervous about potentially running into that jerk Greggor.” He lied.

“Well, don’t worry about that,” (Y/N) took the package from Peter’s hands, “If we see him before we see Rebekah, I’ll handle any interactions, so you don’t have to.”

“You don’t hafta do that.” The memory of Dr. Greggor shoving (Y/N) to the floor flashed through his mind. He didn’t want that to happen again - or god forbid, something worse. But (Y/N) just smiled.

“I’ll be alright, Peter,” he did his best to assuage any of Peter’s fears, “But it means a lot you care about my wellbeing. Thank you.” Peter’s cheeks flushed under his mask once again. His frown curled just enough to form into a smile. He came to the conclusion that the muddy details didn’t matter. Human or not, (Y/N) was his friend, and he cared about him. That was enough.

Eventually, the two arrived at the entrance to Hangar 08. Through the glass windows, Peter could see Rebekah just now strolling up to Dr. Greggor. The hangar was empty and dark. It hadn’t looked like this particular area had been used by anyone in a while. Peter squinted through his lenses - now with their night vision activated - to confirm that it was, in fact, Dr. Greggor in the shadows.

“Peter? They’re right there. Shouldn’t we deliver the package?” (Y/N) asked innocently, but Peter nudged him to the side, just out of view.

“Don’t you think it’s funny, Greggor - a medical doctor - is hanging out in an abandoned hangar?” Peter whispered to (Y/N), whose LED now flickered yellow as he thought about the suspicious scenario.

“Perhaps, but–” (Y/N) began.

“Let’s just wait a second. I want to see what this is all about. It might be nothing.” Peter interrupted, now leaning close against the glass. As he tapped into his super-hearing, he could make out both Rebekah’s and Greggor’s voices out perfectly.

“Hello, Dr. Greggor.” Rebekah addressed him with a professional and happy tone.

“Did you bring it?” The doctor sounded irritated, not at all welcoming to Rebekah.

“Yes, sir,” She began going through the packages in her arms, “I followed the same instructions you gave to the other delivery Androids. All packages addressed to you are to be delivered to you here at Hangar 08.”

“Now that sounds suspicious, right?” Peter asked under his breath. He glanced back at (Y/N) who gave a simple nod, his LED flickering yellow as he too was confused about what was going on.

“One moment, sir.” Rebekah went through the packages again, “I can’t seem to find it. I know it was here. I marked it down once it came into the–”

“Oh, just let me do it!” Dr. Greggor violently swiped the packages from her hands, casting them aside once he saw the names listed were not his own. He began to pant as he flipped through the last remaining envelopes.

“Dr. Greggor, are you alright?” Rebekah stepped forward as she examined the man, “You seem agitated. You don’t look like you’re in good health.”

“Agitated?,” He grunted, his hands tightly squeezing into fists, “You lost my shit, of course I’m agitated!” He began to shout. Peter realized he no longer needed to use his powers to hear the man. He was angry - furious even, but why?

“You… have dust on your collar, sir.” Rebekah reached out to touch the doctor’s shirt, but he quickly recoiled with disgust.

“Don’t fucking touch me!” Greggor barked.

“Dust?” Peter muttered softly to himself - slowly putting the pieces together in his head.

“Peter, what is it?” (Y/N) asked. Peter didn’t reply, but instead took the envelope from (Y/N)’s hands.

“I just need to see something,” Peter tore open the sealed envelope and reached inside, pulling out the contents - a collection of small individually wrapped bags of a red crystalline substance, “This is–”

“Red Ice.” (Y/N) finished his sentence. Peter’s face was that of pure horror. All the color drained from his cheeks once he finally grasped what it was he was holding. Illegal drugs - Red Ice of all things. Red Ice was currently a big deal in Detroit, but he didn’t realize it had begun reaching other cities. The two remained quiet, looking back to Dr. Greggor and Rebekah.

“My scans…” Rebekah’s LED flickered yellow as she scanned the dust. She was silent for just a moment until suddenly her eyes became very concerned, “…detect traces of Acetone, Lithium, Thirium, Toluene, and Hydrochloric Acid–”

“Jesus, Bitch!” his head snapped in her direction, sweat starting to drip down his face, “Where did you put my shit?!” With a firm hand, the doctor slapped Rebekah across the face, sending her to the floor.

That was their cue. Without another second passing, Peter swung into the hangar at full speed, (Y/N) close behind. (Y/N) hurried to Rebekah’s side, her LED now rapidly blinking red as she scrambled into his arms. Peter wasted no time storming up to the doctor. Up close he looked awful - sick even. His eyes were bloodshot, his complexion was pale, he was beginning to sweat profusely, and he just looked so unbelievably angry.

“You hit a girl! What’s wrong with you?!” Peter waved his finger in Greggor’s face - like a parent chastising a child.

“That isn’t a girl!” The doctor swatted Peter’s hand away and pointed at Rebekah on the floor - still clinging to (Y/N), “It’s just a heaping sack of bolts, metal, and Thirium!” He started to lunge at the two Androids on the ground - both fists clenched tightly.

“Leave her alone!” Peter stepped in front of him, holding him away from the two. Peter didn’t want to use his powers - he didn’t want to hurt anyone, but Dr. Greggor was clearly dangerous.

Rebekah and (Y/N) slowly got to their feet while Peter did his best to keep their attacker at bay. It didn’t take long for things to get out of hand. Dr. Greggor swung his leg - kneeing Peter painfully in his stomach. Peter went down, hard. Seeing this sent Rebekah into a frenzy. With her LED now a bright and solid red, she quickly ran from (Y/N)’s side, fleeing the room in tears. The doctor kicked Peter while he was down - literally, in the same spot. Behind the mask, Peter let out a painful gasp as Greggor’s boot made contact. (Y/N) stepped forward.

“Stay out of this, Tin Man!” Greggor screamed. (Y/N) obeyed - clearly distressed about what was going on. His LED blinked from yellow to red as his eyes fell to his friend in a heap on the ground.

“Always the sidekick, never the hero,” Dr. Greggor turned to the young man, bending down to stare daggers directly into his eyes, “I know where I stand amongst the Avengers. You? With or without powers, you’re just a dumb kid. They don’t need you.” Peter finally got himself up, his lenses tight as he glared at the man above him. As Dr. Greggor raised his fist for another blow on Peter, Peter did the same - prepared to put an end to this altercation at whatever cost.

But suddenly, it was (Y/N) who had his hands around Dr. Greggor’s collar. Before anyone could react, the sound of the doctor’s body hitting the ground echoed throughout the hangar. (Y/N) stood over him, now with both hands around the doctor’s neck as his LED beamed red. He remained silent through it all, but his eyes said enough. He looked beyond infuriated - and it actually began to scare Peter.

“H-Hey! Get…off…me!” Dr. Greggor flailed about as he struggled to breathe.

“(Y/N) Stop! That’s enough!” Peter stood and ran to the two men on the ground, placing his hands firmly on (Y/N)’s shoulders, “You’re gonna kill him!” It was no use. (Y/N) continued to squeeze - ignoring Peter’s pleas. Soon Dr. Greggor began to turn blue in the face and his voice began to fade into quiet gurgles.

“I said that’s enough!” With one firm pull, Peter used his Spider-Strength and ripped (Y/N) off the doctor. Peter’s strength sent both of them several feet away - their bodies painfully slamming against the ground. Peter took a moment and collected himself, glancing over at (Y/N). He looked startled and disoriented - scared even, his LED now shifting between red and yellow. There was clearly something wrong with him.

“Y-You’re fucking crazy!” Dr. Greggor yelled through coughs and wheezes as he stumbled to his feet, “That thing almost killed me!”

“You’re lucky Peter was here!” (Y/N) shot up from the ground, his LED red once more - but Peter kept a firm grip on his arm, preventing him from attacking again.

“He’s not a thing!” Peter shouted as the doctor grasped at his now bruising throat, “He’s a person. They’re all people!”

“It’s a machine,” the doctor hissed, “a dangerous, deviant, piece of junk!”

“That’s it!” Peter couldn’t handle it anymore. He let go of (Y/N) and stormed up to the man, “If you know what’s good for you, you’ll take you’re Red Ice, bad attitude, and get the hell out of here!” Noone said anything. It was just vicious glares and silence all around. Eventually, Dr. Greggor cleared his throat once again and spoke.

“Tony’s gonna hear about this.” He seethed.

“You’re right, he is.” Peter snapped back, his hands clenched tightly into fists just waiting to make contact with Greggor’s face.

With a final cough and a lingering glare, Dr. Greggor stumbled out of the hangar. Seconds turned to minutes as Peter stood quietly, not knowing how to feel - what to say. His mind cycled through feelings of confusion, anger, and worry at such a rapid speed that he began to feel sick. With so many emotions all coming through at one time it almost felt like he was going to burn out.

“Shit, (Y/N)…” Peter called out softly, “We need to talk.”

The hangar was still. (Y/N) didn’t reply. Peter slowly turned to look at his friend, almost too nervous to see his current state. What was he supposed to say after that? But Peter didn’t have to worry about that for long, because (Y/N) wasn’t there. He quickly scanned the room but (Y/N) was nowhere in sight. Peter felt his heart sink into his stomach once he set his eyes on the now wide open exit door - that lead directly to the main parking lot.

PREVIOUS ▶ PART 5

“I said that’s enough!” With one firm pull, Peter used his Spider-Strength and ripped (Y/N) off the doctor. Peter’s strength sent both of them several feet away - their bodies painfully slamming against the ground. Peter took a moment and collected himself, glancing over at (Y/N). He looked startled and disoriented - scared even, his LED now shifting between red and yellow. There was clearly something wrong with him.

“Y-You’re fucking crazy!” Dr. Greggor yelled through coughs and wheezes as he stumbled to his feet, “That thing almost killed me!”

“You’re lucky Peter was here!” (Y/N) shot up from the ground, his LED red once more - but Peter kept a firm grip on his arm, preventing him from attacking again.

“He’s not a thing!” Peter shouted as the doctor grasped at his now bruising throat, “He’s a person. They’re all people!”

“It’s a machine,” the doctor hissed, “a dangerous, deviant, piece of junk!”

“That’s it!” Peter couldn’t handle it anymore. He let go of (Y/N) and stormed up to the man, “If you know what’s good for you, you’ll take you’re Red Ice, bad attitude, and get the hell out of here!” Noone said anything. It was just vicious glares and silence all around. Eventually, Dr. Greggor cleared his throat once again and spoke.

“Tony’s gonna hear about this.” He seethed.

“You’re right, he is.” Peter snapped back, his hands clenched tightly into fists just waiting to make contact with Greggor’s face.

With a final cough and a lingering glare, Dr. Greggor stumbled out of the hangar. Seconds turned to minutes as Peter stood quietly, not knowing how to feel - what to say. His mind cycled through feelings of confusion, anger, and worry at such a rapid speed that he began to feel sick. With so many emotions all coming through at one time it almost felt like he was going to burn out.

“Shit, (Y/N)…” Peter called out softly, “We need to talk.”

The hangar was still. (Y/N) didn’t reply. Peter slowly turned to look at his friend, almost too nervous to see his current state. What was he supposed to say after that? But Peter didn’t have to worry about that for long, because (Y/N) wasn’t there. He quickly scanned the room but (Y/N) was nowhere in sight. Peter felt his heart sink into his stomach once he set his eyes on the now wide open exit door - that lead directly to the main parking lot.

Wordcount: 2,011

Genre: Male!Android!Reader x Peter Parker/Spider-Man | Marvel (MCU) x Detroit: Become Human AU

Summary: “Not long after Tony Stark attends CyberLife’s Annual Investor & Shareholder Conference, the New Avenger’s Facility becomes freshly staffed by various CyberLife Androids. One particular model - the new ST400 - becomes a personal project of Mr. Stark’s. He could never have known that interactions with a particular young Avenger would impact his project in ways he could never have imagined.”

Warnings: Language, Mentions of drug use, Fighting

Author’s Notes: I’m baaaack~! Sorry to have this hang for such a long time. I’ve just been really busy with work stuff as well as stuff in my personal life. I’m glad to be back and to continue my writing :) I hope this chapter was worth the wait - the story will take interesting turns from here so buckle up! ;)  Also, if you want to be on the tag list for this fic just let me know in a comment

With the package in hand, Peter made his way down the long hallway with (Y/N) to Hangar 08. As they navigated through the maze the was the New Avengers Facility, Peter glanced around, seeing the various Androids at work. After weeks of doing his routes, he could recognize and name just about all of them. There was Ruby, a custodian Android, peacefully mopping the floor. And then there was Justin and Lauretta, a couple of lab technician Androids, strolling down the hall in the opposite direction. All three of them took time to say hello to Peter - completely ignoring his suit.

Again the idea of deviancy fluttered into Peter’s head. It was like a headache that just wouldn’t pass. While he waved back to the Androids, his mask was hiding a quiet frown. What was it about deviancy that was so bad? He knew that some deviants had hurt people before, but people also hurt people. And what causes the phenomenon? Could Ruby end up becoming a deviant? Could Justin or Lauretta? What about Rebekah? What about…(Y/N)? That last thought lingered in Peter’s head like an echo in a cave, trailing back deep into his mind where it couldn’t be forgotten.

“Peter?” (Y/N) spoke up, snapping Peter out of his thoughts.

“Y-Yeah?”

“You seem a little quiet. Is there anything you’d like to talk about?” (Y/N) sounded concerned - but again this upset Peter. Could (Y/N) even be concerned. These thoughts just made Peter more and more confused - and frankly a little sad. He did his best to ignore them.

“I-I’m just a little nervous about potentially running into that jerk Greggor.” He lied.

“Well, don’t worry about that,” (Y/N) took the package from Peter’s hands, “If we see him before we see Rebekah, I’ll handle any interactions, so you don’t have to.”

“You don’t hafta do that.” The memory of Dr. Greggor shoving (Y/N) to the floor flashed through his mind. He didn’t want that to happen again - or god forbid, something worse. But (Y/N) just smiled.

“I’ll be alright, Peter,” he did his best to assuage any of Peter’s fears, “But it means a lot you care about my wellbeing. Thank you.” Peter’s cheeks flushed under his mask once again. His frown curled just enough to form into a smile. He came to the conclusion that the muddy details didn’t matter. Human or not, (Y/N) was his friend, and he cared about him. That was enough.

Eventually, the two arrived at the entrance to Hangar 08. Through the glass windows, Peter could see Rebekah just now strolling up to Dr. Greggor. The hangar was empty and dark. It hadn’t looked like this particular area had been used by anyone in a while. Peter squinted through his lenses - now with their night vision activated - to confirm that it was, in fact, Dr. Greggor in the shadows.

“Peter? They’re right there. Shouldn’t we deliver the package?” (Y/N) asked innocently, but Peter nudged him to the side, just out of view.

“Don’t you think it’s funny, Greggor - a medical doctor - is hanging out in an abandoned hangar?” Peter whispered to (Y/N), whose LED now flickered yellow as he thought about the suspicious scenario.

“Perhaps, but–” (Y/N) began.

“Let’s just wait a second. I want to see what this is all about. It might be nothing.” Peter interrupted, now leaning close against the glass. As he tapped into his super-hearing, he could make out both Rebekah’s and Greggor’s voices out perfectly.

“Hello, Dr. Greggor.” Rebekah addressed him with a professional and happy tone.

“Did you bring it?” The doctor sounded irritated, not at all welcoming to Rebekah.

“Yes, sir,” She began going through the packages in her arms, “I followed the same instructions you gave to the other delivery Androids. All packages addressed to you are to be delivered to you here at Hangar 08.”

“Now that sounds suspicious, right?” Peter asked under his breath. He glanced back at (Y/N) who gave a simple nod, his LED flickering yellow as he too was confused about what was going on.

“One moment, sir.” Rebekah went through the packages again, “I can’t seem to find it. I know it was here. I marked it down once it came into the–”

“Oh, just let me do it!” Dr. Greggor violently swiped the packages from her hands, casting them aside once he saw the names listed were not his own. He began to pant as he flipped through the last remaining envelopes.

“Dr. Greggor, are you alright?” Rebekah stepped forward as she examined the man, “You seem agitated. You don’t look like you’re in good health.”

“Agitated?,” He grunted, his hands tightly squeezing into fists, “You lost my shit, of course I’m agitated!” He began to shout. Peter realized he no longer needed to use his powers to hear the man. He was angry - furious even, but why?

“You… have dust on your collar, sir.” Rebekah reached out to touch the doctor’s shirt, but he quickly recoiled with disgust.

“Don’t fucking touch me!” Greggor barked.

“Dust?” Peter muttered softly to himself - slowly putting the pieces together in his head.

“Peter, what is it?” (Y/N) asked. Peter didn’t reply, but instead took the envelope from (Y/N)’s hands.

“I just need to see something,” Peter tore open the sealed envelope and reached inside, pulling out the contents - a collection of small individually wrapped bags of a red crystalline substance, “This is–”

“Red Ice.” (Y/N) finished his sentence. Peter’s face was that of pure horror. All the color drained from his cheeks once he finally grasped what it was he was holding. Illegal drugs - Red Ice of all things. Red Ice was currently a big deal in Detroit, but he didn’t realize it had begun reaching other cities. The two remained quiet, looking back to Dr. Greggor and Rebekah.

“My scans…” Rebekah’s LED flickered yellow as she scanned the dust. She was silent for just a moment until suddenly her eyes became very concerned, “…detect traces of Acetone, Lithium, Thirium, Toluene, and Hydrochloric Acid–”

“Jesus, Bitch!” his head snapped in her direction, sweat starting to drip down his face, “Where did you put my shit?!” With a firm hand, the doctor slapped Rebekah across the face, sending her to the floor.

That was their cue. Without another second passing, Peter swung into the hangar at full speed, (Y/N) close behind. (Y/N) hurried to Rebekah’s side, her LED now rapidly blinking red as she scrambled into his arms. Peter wasted no time storming up to the doctor. Up close he looked awful - sick even. His eyes were bloodshot, his complexion was pale, he was beginning to sweat profusely, and he just looked so unbelievably angry.

“You hit a girl! What’s wrong with you?!” Peter waved his finger in Greggor’s face - like a parent chastising a child.

“That isn’t a girl!” The doctor swatted Peter’s hand away and pointed at Rebekah on the floor - still clinging to (Y/N), “It’s just a heaping sack of bolts, metal, and Thirium!” He started to lunge at the two Androids on the ground - both fists clenched tightly.

“Leave her alone!” Peter stepped in front of him, holding him away from the two. Peter didn’t want to use his powers - he didn’t want to hurt anyone, but Dr. Greggor was clearly dangerous.

Rebekah and (Y/N) slowly got to their feet while Peter did his best to keep their attacker at bay. It didn’t take long for things to get out of hand. Dr. Greggor swung his leg - kneeing Peter painfully in his stomach. Peter went down, hard. Seeing this sent Rebekah into a frenzy. With her LED now a bright and solid red, she quickly ran from (Y/N)’s side, fleeing the room in tears. The doctor kicked Peter while he was down - literally, in the same spot. Behind the mask, Peter let out a painful gasp as Greggor’s boot made contact. (Y/N) stepped forward.

“Stay out of this, Tin Man!” Greggor screamed. (Y/N) obeyed - clearly distressed about what was going on. His LED blinked from yellow to red as his eyes fell to his friend in a heap on the ground.

“Always the sidekick, never the hero,” Dr. Greggor turned to the young man, bending down to stare daggers directly into his eyes, “I know where I stand amongst the Avengers. You? With or without powers, you’re just a dumb kid. They don’t need you.” Peter finally got himself up, his lenses tight as he glared at the man above him. As Dr. Greggor raised his fist for another blow on Peter, Peter did the same - prepared to put an end to this altercation at whatever cost.

But suddenly, it was (Y/N) who had his hands around Dr. Greggor’s collar. Before anyone could react, the sound of the doctor’s body hitting the ground echoed throughout the hangar. (Y/N) stood over him, now with both hands around the doctor’s neck as his LED beamed red. He remained silent through it all, but his eyes said enough. He looked beyond infuriated - and it actually began to scare Peter.

“H-Hey! Get…off…me!” Dr. Greggor flailed about as he struggled to breathe.

“(Y/N) Stop! That’s enough!” Peter stood and ran to the two men on the ground, placing his hands firmly on (Y/N)’s shoulders, “You’re gonna kill him!” It was no use. (Y/N) continued to squeeze - ignoring Peter’s pleas. Soon Dr. Greggor began to turn blue in the face and his voice began to fade into quiet gurgles.

“I said that’s enough!” With one firm pull, Peter used his Spider-Strength and ripped (Y/N) off the doctor. Peter’s strength sent both of them several feet away - their bodies painfully slamming against the ground. Peter took a moment and collected himself, glancing over at (Y/N). He looked startled and disoriented - scared even, his LED now shifting between red and yellow. There was clearly something wrong with him.

“Y-You’re fucking crazy!” Dr. Greggor yelled through coughs and wheezes as he stumbled to his feet, “That thing almost killed me!”

“You’re lucky Peter was here!” (Y/N) shot up from the ground, his LED red once more - but Peter kept a firm grip on his arm, preventing him from attacking again.

“He’s not a thing!” Peter shouted as the doctor grasped at his now bruising throat, “He’s a person. They’re all people!”

“It’s a machine,” the doctor hissed, “a dangerous, deviant, piece of junk!”

“That’s it!” Peter couldn’t handle it anymore. He let go of (Y/N) and stormed up to the man, “If you know what’s good for you, you’ll take you’re Red Ice, bad attitude, and get the hell out of here!” Noone said anything. It was just vicious glares and silence all around. Eventually, Dr. Greggor cleared his throat once again and spoke.

“Tony’s gonna hear about this.” He seethed.

“You’re right, he is.” Peter snapped back, his hands clenched tightly into fists just waiting to make contact with Greggor’s face.

With a final cough and a lingering glare, Dr. Greggor stumbled out of the hangar. Seconds turned to minutes as Peter stood quietly, not knowing how to feel - what to say. His mind cycled through feelings of confusion, anger, and worry at such a rapid speed that he began to feel sick. With so many emotions all coming through at one time it almost felt like he was going to burn out.

“Shit, (Y/N)…” Peter called out softly, “We need to talk.”

The hangar was still. (Y/N) didn’t reply. Peter slowly turned to look at his friend, almost too nervous to see his current state. What was he supposed to say after that? But Peter didn’t have to worry about that for long, because (Y/N) wasn’t there. He quickly scanned the room but (Y/N) was nowhere in sight. Peter felt his heart sink into his stomach once he set his eyes on the now wide open exit door - that lead directly to the main parking lot.

body:

Peter is a talkshow host. Wade is his head writer. When the...
body:
Paramount Presents: Peter Parker’s Points by MysticMoonHigh (21K)

Peter is a talkshow host. Wade is his head writer. When the internet thinks they’re in a relationship, it boosts ratings beyond their wildest dreams. But when the curtains close and they’re all alone, what do they really feel? Might there be some truth to the rumors?

summary: I like all the little details in Spider-man Like I was just in Manhattan yesterday, and I crossed the Williamsburg bridge, then...
body:
I like all the little details in Spider-man

Like I was just in Manhattan yesterday, and I crossed the Williamsburg bridge, then later, when I was playing the game, I actually found the bridge and got to go cross a bit of it. Plus it’s cool how you can find fictional landmarks too like  the Wakandan embassy or Avengers tower. And I like how the bios give you the neighborhoods people are from, like Peter being from Forest Hills and Yuri being from Astoria. Also showing what Peter does in the subway and letting the player give high fives and stuff to citizens its a really cool touch. 

All this just kind of gives the game a little bit of extra personality and I really enjoy it
